titles.title: A bill to provide for the participation of employees in the judicial branch in the Federal leave transfer program for disasters and emergencies.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Collins without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 227.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
By Senator Collins from Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs filed written report. Report No. 109-158.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Government Reform. H. Rept. 109-449.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 251.

action.text: Mr. Shays moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1736.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 5/31/2006--Public Law. Amends federal civil service law to require the Office of Personnel Management (OPM), after consultation with the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts, to allow federal judicial branch employees to participate in any emergency leave transfer programs for disasters and emergencies.
